intro: Hemitelia kohautiana, commonly known as the Kohaut's hemitelia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of red and purple. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
